body.S: Stress is bad for both your mind and your body. Have you been feeling stressed lately? Try confiding in a friend or family member about what's on your mind.

Have you been feeling stressed lately? Try this fun technique to relax: tense your forearms for five seconds and then release the tension for ten seconds. Repeat this with other areas of your body until you feel more calm.
Have you been feeling stressed lately? Try taking deep breaths and counting slowly to 20 in your head. If that doesn't help, try confiding in a friend or family member about what's on your mind.
Do specific events stress you out? If so, it can be helpful to develop a plan for how to relax before, during, and after the event. Try taking deep breaths or sharing your feelings with a friend!
Physical activity and a healthy diet can help control many risk factors for heart disease. Take a walk today and add some colorful vegetables to your meals!
If you are over the age of 40, you should have your cholesterol levels checked every year to help maintain heart health. Schedule an appointment with your doctor today if you don't already have one!
If you are under the age of 40, you should have your cholesterol levels checked every five years to maintain heart health. Make sure you know the recommended levels for LDL/HDL and triglycerides!

The American Heart Association has identified the following as risk factors for heart disease: smoking, physical inactivity, high cholesterol, high blood pressure, diabetes, obesity, stress, alcohol consumption, and poor diet. Are any of these factors something you would like to change?
Being physically active and having a healthy diet can reduce your risk for heart disease. A heart-healthy lifestyle is your best defense against heart disease!
High blood pressure increases the risk for developing both health disease and kidney failure. Be sure to have regular appointments with your doctor, exercise consistently, and eat healthy foods!
To prevent or manage heart disease, you should exercise for at least 30 minutes 5 days per week. What can you do today to be active?
To prevent or manage heart disease, eat healthy high-fiber foods that are low in cholesterol, trans fats, and saturated fats. Try to eat less than 300mg of cholesterol every day!
To prevent or manage heart disease, try eating vegetables, fruits, and fiber-rich whole-grain foods, and limit how much sodium you eat. Try adding in two 3.5 oz servings of fish per week as well!
To make the most out of your next trip to the grocery store, make a list ahead of time and stick to it. Make sure you include some healthy snacks!
Looking through local grocery fliers to find what items are on sale is a good way to save time and money the next time you go to the grocery store.
Cooking healthy meals can seem time-consuming and complicated at times. Cutting up your veggies ahead of time and saving leftovers for future meals are great ways to save time!
A healthy meal is made up of 50% non-starchy vegetables and fruits, 25% grains, and 25% lean protein (for example, chicken or fish). Fill your grocery cart with these foods!
It may not be realistic to eliminate desserts and sweets completely from your diet. Just remember, indulge in moderation!
Thinking about healthy ways to prepare food for dinner? Try grilling, steaming, or baking meats and veggies to minimize unhealthy fats.
Try to avoid sodas and fruit drinks that are high in sugar and calories. Water is always the healthiest and cheapest option!

Making changes can be difficult. Consider joining a support group with others trying to be more physically active. It's a great way to encourage yourself and others to stay on the path towards a healthy lifestyle!
If you have trouble staying on track, consider writing down your physical activity goals and sharing them with your friends and family. They can cheer you on and hold you accountable!
If you have trouble staying on track, consider writing down your goals for improving your diet and sharing them with your friends and family. They can cheer you on and hold you accountable!
If you're looking for more support, try joining a new fitness club. You might meet other people with similar goals for increasing physical activity who can work with you and encourage you!

Consider speaking with a professional in your community with specialized training in promoting healthy behaviors. You can learn new tips for increasing physical activity and receive extra support in working towards your goals!
